name: libgeotiff
description:
GeoTIFF represents an effort by over 160 different remote sensing, GIS,
cartographic, and surveying related companies and organizations to
establish a TIFF based interchange format for georeferenced raster
imagery.

dependencies.name: gnuconfig
dependencies.description:
The GNU config.guess and config.sub scripts versioned by timestamp.
This package can be used as a build dependency for autotools packages
that ship a tarball with outdated config.guess and config.sub files.

dependencies.name: zlib
dependencies.description:
A free, general-purpose, legally unencumbered lossless data-compression
library.

dependencies.name: jpeg
dependencies.description:
libjpeg is a widely used free library with functions for handling the
JPEG image data format. It implements a JPEG codec (encoding and
decoding) alongside various utilities for handling JPEG data.

dependencies.name: libtiff
dependencies.description: LibTIFF - Tag Image File Format (TIFF) Library and Utilities.

dependencies.name: proj
dependencies.description:
PROJ is a generic coordinate transformation software, that transforms
geospatial coordinates from one coordinate reference system (CRS) to
another. This includes cartographic projections as well as geodetic
transformations.

dependent_to.name: saga-gis
dependent_to.description:
SAGA is a GIS for Automated Geoscientific Analyses and has been
designed for an easy and effective implementation of spatial algorithms.
It offers a comprehensive, growing set of geoscientific methods and
provides an easily approachable user interface with many visualisation
options

dependent_to.name: liblas
dependent_to.description:
libLAS is a C/C++ library for reading and writing the very common LAS
LiDAR format.

dependent_to.name: grads
dependent_to.description:
The Grid Analysis and Display System (GrADS) is an interactive desktop
tool that is used for easy access, manipulation, and visualization of
earth science data. GrADS has two data models for handling gridded and
station data. GrADS supports many data file formats, including binary
(stream or sequential), GRIB (version 1 and 2), NetCDF, HDF (version 4
and 5), and BUFR (for station data).

dependent_to.name: gdl
dependent_to.description:
A free and open-source IDL/PV-WAVE compiler. GNU Data Language (GDL) is
a free/libre/open source incremental compiler compatible with IDL and to
some extent with PV-WAVE.

dependent_to.name: vapor
dependent_to.description:
VAPOR is the Visualization and Analysis Platform for Ocean, Atmosphere,
and Solar Researchers. VAPOR provides an interactive 3D visualization
environment that can also produce animations and still frame images.

dependent_to.name: gdal
dependent_to.description:
GDAL (Geospatial Data Abstraction Library) is a translator library for
raster and vector geospatial data formats that is released under an
X/MIT style Open Source license by the Open Source Geospatial
Foundation. As a library, it presents a single raster abstract data
model and vector abstract data model to the calling application for all
supported formats. It also comes with a variety of useful command line
utilities for data translation and processing.
